column4: Trying to playback DVD i-robot. Just re-installed. had no probs before. Followed directions on web. perhaps I missed something... Any help?
It plays warning and rating intro, then quits... ???
Anyone have time to field a DVD playback question? It plays the warning and rating, then kicks out.
Are you doing dual monitors or anything fancy?   What do you have driver listed as in xorg.conf?
Nothing special - Driver "nvidia" - (card - 7600 GT) - restricted drivers work once - work great in fact - then reboot and gui is dead (although you can login blind and hear sound)
so on subsequent boots it just boots to black screen (upon going into gdm)?
Exactly, and once in a while, if I revert to a vesa driver, then reinstall the restricted drivers... it will work again, until I reboot. It's like nothing I've ever come accross...

I can tell you I've had similar issue with my LCD where it didn't like the refresh rate/resolution being passed by the card... I solved it by "forcing" the refresh rates in xorg.conf specified in monitor manual...
Ok, I will try to find resolutions... I figured that might be the case, but I can't find out... it SHOULD be around 75 Hz
You're familiar with xorg, I trust?
Yes, quite a bit, but the sync area to be honest... I've never had to deal with both horizontal AND vertical before, so I'm not sure what values to enter in there...
monitor docs should give you refresh rates for given resolutions... TO "force" I put VertRefresh (or whatever) 80.0-80.0 etc...
Ok, I will try forcing it with set values from the same rate-to-rate and see what I get. Appreciate the pointer, wasn't sure if I should go to the route or not.. Much appreciated. :)
Don't be afraid to reinstall driver too - sometimes it gets borked :)
Yeah, been there and done that several times to be sure... will give it a go after refresh rates though if still a problem.
